GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Triatge a la recepció
Les recepcionistes poden assignar una prioritat més alta a un pacient en funció dels seus símptomes. \n\nSala requerida: Recepció
Palpació abdominal
Tipus d'examen físic. L'examinador palpa (toca) nou àrees de l'abdomen del pacient, dues vegades, tant superficialment com en profunditat. \n\nSala requerida: Qualsevol oficina / unitat de diagnòstic
Angiografia
Un mètode d'imatge fet servir per visualitzar el lumen dels vasos sanguinis i els òrgans, particularment les àrteries, les venes i el cor. \n\nSala requerida: sala de CAG
Audiometria
La prova audiomètrica determina el nivell d'escolta del pacient. \n\nSala requerida: Qualsevol oficina / unitat de diagnòstic
Mostreig microbial

El mostreig microbial és la recollida de mostres del pacient (p.e. fluids corporals, esput, excrements) per al seu anàlisi. 

Sala requerida: Laboratori STAT 

Equipament requerit: cristalleria + microscopi
Cultiu microbial

Cultiu de laboratori de la mostra obtinguda del pacient per tal de determinar si hi ha bacteris present i quina mena de bacteri és. 

Sala requerida: Laboratori STAT 

Equipament requesit: cristalleria + microscopi
Barium swallow

Una prova en que el pacient ingereix una mostra de sulfat de bari que es mostra en els raig X. S'utilitza per examinar el lumen de l'esòfag, l'estòmac i els intestins. \n\nSala requerida: sala de rajos X
Prova visual bàsica

Prova visual comuna utilitzada per examinar l'agudesa visual del pacient. 

Sala requerida: Qualsevol sala / unitat de diagnòstic 

Equipament requerit: prova d'ulls
Biòpsia - mostreig

Un procediment quirúrgic pel qual una peça de teixit (p.e. pulmò, fetge, intestí) s'extreu per a fer-ne proves. 

Sala requerida: Laboratori STAT 

Equipament requerit: cristalleria + microscopi
Biòpsia - testeig

La peça de teixit extreta durant el procediment de biòpsia s'examina sota el microscopi i es tracta amb diverses preparacions per a permetre proves més específiques. 

Sala requerida: Laboratori STAT 

\Equipament requerit: cristalleria + microscopi
Mesura de la pressió sanguínia
La clàssica i manual mesura de la pressió i el pols (freqüència cardíaca) del pacient fent ús d'un esfigomanòmetre. \n\nSala requerida: Qualsevol oficina / unitat de diagnòstic
Extracció de sang

L'extracció d'una mostra de sang (venosa o arterial) del pacient per a anàlisis i proves. 

Sala requerida: Laboratori STAT 

Equipament requerit: Hematoanalyzer
Prova de sang

Anàlisi de laboratori d'una mostra de sang. 

Sala requerida: Laboratori STAT 

Equipament requerit: Hematoanalyzer
CBC - mostreig

Mostreig de la sang per un test CBC (comptatge complert de sang) 

Sala requerida: Laboratori STAT 

Equipament requerit: Hematoanalyzer
CBC - testeig

El testeig de CBC (comptatge complert de sang) compta totes les cèl·lules trobades a la sang i determina si hi ha un increment o reducció d'alguna d'aquestes cèl·lules. 

Sala requerida: Laboratori STAT 

Equipament requerit: Hematoanalyzer
Anàlisi de sang - UCI

Anàlisi de sang especial que s'utilitza principalment a les unitats de cures intensives. 

Sala requerida: sala UCI 

Equipament requerit: Hematoanalyzer
Urgent Echo

Special critical care echocardiography used mainly in intensive care units or trauma centers to assess if the heart is pumping properly, if there is any fluid in the pericardium (the sac around the heart) or fluid surrounding the lungs. 

Required room: ICU room 

Required equipment: FAST usg
CRP

C-reactive protein (CRP) is diagnostic test based on a quick blood test measuring the concentration of C-reactive protein that is indicative of inflammatory and infectious diseases. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
TC

La tomografia computeritzada (TC) és una tècnica d'imatge que crea imatges detallades dels òrgans interns i dels ossos. Mitjançant l'injecció intravenosa d'un contrast o fent que el pacient prengui contrast, l'ús de la TC permet diagnosticar un ampli ventall de malalties. \n\nSala requerida: sala de TC
CT - enterography

Computed tomography (CT) enterography is diagnostic imaging modality creating detailed images of the intestines by injecting intravenous contrast after the patient has ingested liquid contrast. \n\nRequired room: CT room
Examen de l'oïda
Examen i inspecció visual de les oides del pacient, incloent el canal auditiu i el timpà. \n\nSala requerida: Qualsevol sala / unitat de diagnòstic
ECG
Electrocardiography (ECG) is the recording of the heart's electrical activity by electrodes on the skin. \n\nRequired room: Cardiography unit
EEG
Electroencephalography (EEG) is the recording of the brain's electrical activity by equipping the patient with a hat containing many electrodes. \n\nRequired room: Neurolab
Echo
Echocardiography is the ultrasonographic assessment of the patient's heart and large veins and arteries entering and leaving the heart. \n\nRequired room: Cardiography unit
EMG

Electromyography (EMG) is the recording and evaluation of the electrical activity of the patient's muscles. \n\nRequired room: doctor's office / Observation room / Office/Diagnostic unit at Orthopaedy dpt
Evaluation
Considering all the symptoms and examinations recently carried out to specify the diagnosis. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
FAST
Fast Assessment with Sonography in Trauma (FAST) is a special ultrasonography method used in the evaluation of trauma patients and intensive care unit patients. \n\nRequired room: Trauma center, ICU
Elastase test - sampling

The collection of a stool sample from the patient in order to quantify the amount of the elastase produced by the pancreas. It indicates the actual function of the pancreas. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: RIA
Elastase test - testing

The measurement of elastase in a stool sample from a patient. The amount indicates the actual function of the pancreas. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: RIA
Mycologic sampling

Collecting various samples from the patient's body for cultivation in order to determine if fungal species are present or not. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Glassware + Microscope
Fungal cultivation

Laboratory cultivation of the specific samples obtained from the patient's body. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Glassware + Microscope
Gastroscopy

A procedure where a flexible tube (endoscope) with a tiny video camera and a light source in the end is inserted through the mouth in order to examine the upper part of digestive tract.\n\nRequired room: Office / Diagnostic unit at General Surgery dpt / Internal Medicine dpt / Cardiology dpt
Gonioscopy
Gonioscopy is an eye examination used to evaluate the drainage system of the eye.
Heart monitoring

Longterm monitoring of the heart's eletrical activity. 

Required room: ICU / Trauma center / Observation room 

Requiered equipment: Wall monitor / Anesthetic machine
Chest auscultation
The auscultation (listening with a stethoscope) of the heart and lungs. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
Laryngoscopy

A procedure where a flexible tube (endoscope) with a tiny video camera and a light source in the end is inserted through the nose to examine the larynx, glottis, and vocal chords. Laryngoscopy is also used to facilitate tracheal intubation. \n\nRequired room: doctor's office / Observation room / ICU
MRI

Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) creates detailed images of the anatomy and physiology of the body and internal organs by using a magnetic fields, magnetics waves, and radio waves. \n\nRequired room: MRI room
Nasal cavity inspection
Examination and visual inspection of the patient's nose including the nasal cavity. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
Neck palpation
Palpation (touching) of the patient's neck. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
Neurological testing
Different simple and specific questions and tests that provide information about the patient's central nervous system. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
Ophthalmoscopy

A procedure where the fundus/retina is visualised through a funduscope/opthalmoscope. \n\nRequired room: doctor's office / Observation room / Trauma center / ICU / Office/Diagnostic unit at Internal Medicine dpt / Neurology dpt
Oral cavity inspection
Examination and visual inspection of the patient's oral cavity. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
PCR - sampling

Sampling of biological material for polymerase chain reaction analysis in the laboratory. Examination is quick, cheap and exact. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Thermal cycler
PCR - testing

Polymerase chain reaction is quick examination method of identifying infectious disease caused by bacteria or viruses. Examination is quick, cheap and exact. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Thermal cycler
Perimetry
Perimetry is ophtalmology test that systematically tests the complete field of vision. \n\nRequired room: Office / Diagnostic Unit at Neurology dpt.
Peritoneal fluid analysis - sampling

Sampling of peritoneal fluid with a large needle and syringe through the abdominal wall. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Medical centrifuge + Lab analyzer
Peritoneal fluid analysis - testing

Biochemical test that analyzes the fluid collected from the peritoneal space. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Medical centrifuge + Lab analyzer
Physical examination
Examination of the specific area on the patient's body. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
Interview
Interviewing the patient to get as much information as possible about his medical condition. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
Serologic sampling

Drawing of a blood sample for serologic tests. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Medical centrifuge + RIA
Serologic testing

Special blood test examining specific antibodies and antigens. Antibodies are proteins made by human immune system to neutralize pathogens. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Medical centrifuge + RIA
Skin allergy test

Injection of a small amount of different of allergen extracts into the skin usually on the arm to confirm or deny the allergic reactions to specific allergens. \n\nRequired room: Offices / Diagnostic units at Emergency dpt / ICU dpt / Neurology dpt
Speech listening
Listening to speech flow of the patient. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
CSF sampling

Sampling of cerebrospinal fluid is performed by inserting a needle through the lower back into the spinal canal, draining a small amount of cerebrospinal fluid. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Medical centrifuge + Lab analyzer
CSF analysis

Process of analysis of cerebrospinal fluid in the laboratory. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Medical centrifuge + Lab analyzer
Spirometry
One of the most common pulmonary function test, measuring lung function. \n\nRequired room: Offices / Diagnostic Units at Emergency dpt / ICU dpt / Internal Medicine dpt
Stool collecting

Procedure to collect a sample of patient's stool for further analysis. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Stool analyzer
Stool analysis

Analysis of the patient's stool for bacteria, blood, parasites etc. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Stool analyzer
Sweat Chloride Test
Special biochemical test used to diagnose cystic fibrosis. \n\nRequired room: Office / Diagnostic unit at Internal Medicine dpt
Temperature measurement
Examination to determine the current body temperature. \n\nRequired room: Any office / Diagnostic unit
Thorax percussion

Examination consisting of systematically tapping on the thorax to identify areas with less air within the thorax. \n\nRequired room: Offices / Diagnostic Units at General Surgery dpt / Internal Medicine dpt / Cardiology dpt
Tonometry
Test that measures pressure inside the eye also known as intraocular pressure. \n\nRequired room: Neurolab
Transient elastography
Special ultra sound imaging method that maps elastic properties and stiffness of soft tissues in the internal organs. \n\nRequired room: Sonography unit
PS blood control

Post surgery blood analysis is used in post-operative care in patients that could suffer from sepsis. 

Required room: Cardiography unit 

Required equipment: Lab analyzer
Urine analysis - sampling

Sampling of mid-stream urine from a patient, or from a patient's catheter. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Lab analyzer
Urine analysis - testing

Biochemical analysis of a urine sample. 

Required room: Stat Lab 

Required equipment: Lab analyzer
USG
Ultrasonography is a medical imaging technique using ultrasound waves, resulting in visualization of both soft and hard tissues and organs. \n\nRequired room: Sonography unit
X-ray back
X-ray imaging of the bones of the back. \n\nRequired room: X-ray room
X-ray head
X-ray imaging of the bones of the skull. \n\nRequired room: X-ray room
X-ray lower limb
X-ray imaging of the bones of the lower limb. \n\nRequired room: X-ray room
X-ray chest
X-ray imaging of the bones and shadows of the thorax. \n\nRequired room: X-ray room
X-ray upper limb
X-ray imaging of the bones the arm. \n\nRequired room: X-ray room
Differential diagnosis
Special case-review that reduces the amount of possible diagnoses. Can only be performed by a doctor with advanced diagnosis specialization.
